contentrichtext.text: [[File:Fuet.jpg|thumb|''Fuet'']] '''Fuet''' ({{IPA-ca|fuˈɛt|ec}}, {{IPA-ca|fuˈet|wc}}) is a [[Catalan cuisine|Catalan]] thin, cured, dry [[sausage]] of [[pork]] meat in a pork gut. The most famous is made in the [[Comarques of Catalonia|''comarca'' (county)]] of [[Osona]] and is also known as ''Vic fuet'' (''fuet de Vic'', after the city of [[Vic]], capital of Osona).<ref>Coupe, Alison, (editor). ''Michelin Green Guide Spain''. Michelin Apa Publications, 2010. ISBN 978-1-906261-92-4 p57</ref> Other places that have long tradition of making it are the city of [[Olot]] and the surrounding zones. ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Commons}} {{Salami}} [[Category:Spanish sausages]] [[Category:Catalan cuisine]] {{Meat-stub}} {{Catalonia-cuisine-stub}}
